title: Cannot 'get' dataset (MPI-Leipzig Mind Brain Body)
body:
#### What is the problem?

I can clone the dataset to the directory (1), but then fail to get the files of specific subject (2)
1) datalad clone git@github.com:OpenNeuroDatasets/ds000221.git MPI-Leipzig_Mind-Brain-Body
2) datalad get sub-010002/ses-01/anat/

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

```
bash-3.2$ datalad clone git@github.com:OpenNeuroDatasets/ds000221.git MPI-Leipzig_Mind-Brain-Body
[INFO   ] Scanning for unlocked files (this may take some time)                                                                                                                               
[INFO   ] Unable to parse git config from origin                                                                                                                                              
[INFO   ] [ERROR] [Errno 32] Broken pipe [sshrun.py:__call__:124] (BrokenPipeError) 
[INFO   ] Remote origin does not have git-annex installed; setting annex-ignore
|   This could be a problem with the git-annex installation on the remote. Please make sure that git-annex-shell is available in PATH when you ssh into the remote. Once you have fixed the git-annex installation, run: git annex enableremote origin 
[INFO   ] access to 1 dataset sibling s3-PRIVATE not auto-enabled, enable with:
| 		datalad siblings -d "/Users/sofievalk/myanalysis/MPI-Leipzig_Mind-Brain-Body" enable -s s3-PRIVATE 
install(ok): /Users/sofievalk/myanalysis/MPI-Leipzig_Mind-Brain-Body (dataset)
bash-3.2$ cd MPI-Leipzig_Mind-Brain-Body
bash-3.2$ du -sh
 47M	.
bash-3.2$ datalad status --annex
7605 annex'd files (390.5 GB recorded total size)
nothing to save, working tree clean
bash-3.2$ datalad get sub-010002/ses-01/anat/
Total (0 ok, 7 failed out of 7):   0%|                                                                                                                            | 0.00/62.4M [00:00<?, ?B/s][WARNING] Running get resulted in stderr output: git-annex: get: 7 failed
```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

0.13.3

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?

No

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)

Uhm not really (I can do the tutorial)
